data.title: Zeven is Mahesh Bhupathi’s ace for the local sports market
data.meta_description: The startup was born when Bhupathis personal experiences and Javeris inclination to build a home-grown brand sprouted
data.text:
Synopsis

The startup was born when Bhupathi’s personal experiences and Javeri’s inclination to build a home-grown brand sprouted

#Budget' 2024 with ET

Union Budget and Economic Survey 2024 Live Updates

Economic Survey Highlights: Reading between the lines

Economic Survey on if India can fill mfg void left by China

BENGALURU: A frequent joke about the Indian weather is that there are three seasons: Hot, Hot and Hot. But this joke was taken seriously by multi-sport apparel startup Zeven, which has led them to design products that are conducive to Indian weather and terrain.

The startup is run by tennis star Mahesh Bhupathi, along with former Nike country manager (South Asia) Hemchandra Javeri. The startup was born when Bhupathi’s personal experiences and Javeri’s inclination to build a home-grown brand sprouted. "About three-anda-half years ago, I started speaking with Hemu (the other founder) on a home-grown sports brand, and soon one thing led to another," said Bhupathi, director of Zeven.

The Zeven team spent a good three years in getting to know what actually needs to be done to make the product ‘Indian’. Take, for example, cricket. Zeven has designed three shoes, each for batsmen, bowlers and all-rounders. "We went to different fields in Mumbai, Bengaluru, Hyderabad, and Pune, and understood how Indian ground conditions are different," said Ravi Shekhar, head (footwear), Zeven.

"The batsmen shoes have a slightly tighter grip on the in-step so as to have a snug fit, the all-rounder’s shoe is more ventilated. For the bowlers shoes, we have given more support to the ankle, as it is the most injury-prone part for the bowler," he added. One can also choose between titanium and steel spikes.

The other pain point that Zeven aims to tackle is cost. Zeven’s stress on ‘affordability’ is to make sure that every Indian plays sports. "The primary angle is ‘Made for India at an affordable price’. If look at the bigger vision, it is about making Indians play sports. We want people to be in a community of sportsmen," said Javeri, Zeven’s chairman.

The company presently offers footwear, apparel and accessories across six sport categories: cricket, football, tennis, run, walk and gym. "I have been wearing Zeven since August last year and have been testing the products. The results have been great, both at the comfort level and at the fit level," said Rohan Bopanna, tennis player.
